summary: This document is an email chain from July 28, 2019, discussing the status of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It details his complaints about conditions (numb arm, malfunctioning toilet, lack of meals) and the decision to remove him from Psych Observation/Suicide Watch. The document is significant as it provides a snapshot of his condition and complaints just days before his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate being discussed; he complains of a numb right arm and neck, a malfunctioning toilet, and receiving only one meal while in attorney conferences all day.

persons.name: Nurse
persons.context: A nurse who saw Epstein regarding his complaint about his numb right arm.

events.title: Epstein's Complaints and Removal from Observation
events.description: Email correspondence details inmate Jeffrey Epstein complaining of a numb right arm and neck, a toilet that ran for 45 minutes, and receiving only one meal while in attorney conferences. Based on his presentation, he is taken off Psych Observation and Suicide Watch.

keyFacts: On July 28, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was reported as 'psychologically stable' and was removed from Psych Observation and Suicide Watch.
Epstein complained of physical ailments including a numb right arm, an inability to make a fist, and numbness in his neck.
Epstein reported a toilet in his cell ran for 45 minutes the previous night, which he found so aversive he resorted to urinating in a cup.
Epstein complained about his schedule, stating he was in Attorney Conference from 8 AM to 8 PM and only received one meal (a sandwich) around 4:15 PM the prior day.
